payload.content: The common belief that more agents in multi-agent AI systems automatically leads to increased capability is incorrect; the reality is more complex.

name: The common belief that more agents in multi-agent AI systems automatically leads
content: The common belief that more agents in multi-agent AI systems automatically leads to increased capability is incorrect; the reality is more complex.

payload.content: Adding more agents to an AI system can actually degrade its performance.

name: Adding more agents to an AI system can actually degrade its performance.
content: Adding more agents to an AI system can actually degrade its performance.

payload.content: Serial dependencies within multi-agent architectures prevent the efficient conversion of computational resources into system capability.

name: Serial dependencies within multi-agent architectures prevent the efficient conve
content: Serial dependencies within multi-agent architectures prevent the efficient conversion of computational resources into system capability.

payload.content: Complexity in multi-agent AI systems should be concentrated in orchestration mechanisms rather than within individual agents.

name: Complexity in multi-agent AI systems should be concentrated in orchestration mec
content: Complexity in multi-agent AI systems should be concentrated in orchestration mechanisms rather than within individual agents.

payload.content: A study by Google and MIT found that when single-agent accuracy surpasses 45%, incorporating additional agents leads to diminishing or even negative returns.

name: A study by Google and MIT found that when single-agent accuracy surpasses 45%, i
content: A study by Google and MIT found that when single-agent accuracy surpasses 45%, incorporating additional agents leads to diminishing or even negative returns.

payload.content: Applying the 'team dynamics' metaphor to multi-agent AI systems introduces human coordination challenges that have historically been difficult to resolve.

name: Applying the 'team dynamics' metaphor to multi-agent AI systems introduces human
content: Applying the 'team dynamics' metaphor to multi-agent AI systems introduces human coordination challenges that have historically been difficult to resolve.

payload.content: Effective and scalable multi-agent architectures are characterized by simplicity, often featuring two tiers, 'ignorant' workers, no shared state, and planned terminations.

name: Effective and scalable multi-agent architectures are characterized by simplicity
content: Effective and scalable multi-agent architectures are characterized by simplicity, often featuring two tiers, 'ignorant' workers, no shared state, and planned terminations.

payload.content: For developers deploying AI agents at scale, investment should prioritize orchestration systems over efforts to enhance the intelligence of individual agents.

name: For developers deploying AI agents at scale, investment should prioritize orches
content: For developers deploying AI agents at scale, investment should prioritize orchestration systems over efforts to enhance the intelligence of individual agents.

payload.content: Principles for scalable multi-agent AI systems include: two-tier architecture (not teams), workers remaining ignorant of the big picture, no shared state between workers, and planning for endings rather than continuous operation.

name: Principles for scalable multi-agent AI systems include: two-tier architecture (n
content: Principles for scalable multi-agent AI systems include: two-tier architecture (not teams), workers remaining ignorant of the big picture, no shared state between workers, and planning for endings rather than continuous operation.

payload.content: Prompts are more critical than coordination infrastructure in multi-agent AI systems.

name: Prompts are more critical than coordination infrastructure in multi-agent AI sys
content: Prompts are more critical than coordination infrastructure in multi-agent AI systems.

payload.content: A system comprising 10,000 'dumb' agents can outperform one brilliant agent.

name: A system comprising 10,000 'dumb' agents can outperform one brilliant agent.
content: A system comprising 10,000 'dumb' agents can outperform one brilliant agent.
